flashy.plot package¶

Submodules¶

flashy.plot.oneDim module¶

flashy.plot.oneDim.byMass(rads, dens)[source]¶

Returns a mass abscissa for plots.

flashy.plot.oneDim.customFormatter(factor, prec=1, width=2)[source]¶

specialized format for plotting labels: width(prec) x 10^factor.

flashy.plot.oneDim.fileProfile(fname, species=['he4 ', 'c12 ', 'o16 ', 'ne20', 'mg24', 'si28', 's32 ', 'ar36', 'ca40', 'ti44', 'cr48', 'fe52', 'ni56'], thresh=1e-06, mrange=[0.0, 0.0], radius=50000000000.0, filetag='prof', show=False)[source]¶

plots a checkpoint file ray through the domain.

Parameters:
  • fname (str) – filename of checkpoint.
  • species (list of str) – list of species names to plot.
  • thresh (float) – ymin for species fraction plot.
  • radius (float) – reach of ray.
  • mrange (list of float) – if set, change the mass range of the abundance plot.
  • filetag (str) – change prefix of png output files.
  • show (bool) – return figure instead of saving it to file.
flashy.plot.oneDim.getDset(filename)[source]¶

Returns the yt dataset (not compatible with batch/parallel scripts)

flashy.plot.oneDim.getExtrema(filename, flist=['density', 'temperature', 'pressure'])[source]¶

returns a list of tuples with extrema for given fields(flist).

flashy.plot.oneDim.getProfData(filename)[source]¶

Returns arrays for radius, dens, temp and a matrix with abundances, as an ordered dictionary.

flashy.plot.oneDim.getProps(profD)[source]¶

returns central dens, temp, rmin, rmax, volume and mass of a 1D profile.

flashy.plot.oneDim.getRay(fname, radius=500000000000.0)[source]¶

returns a ray trace through the domain.

flashy.plot.oneDim.getVelocities(filename)[source]¶

Returns positions of the shock, and both in an outer cj velocities for a file, plus the starting x_match. (xin, xout, cjin, cjout, float(ray.ds.current_time), ray.ds.parameters[‘x_match’])

flashy.plot.oneDim.gridInfo(filename, silent=True)[source]¶

prints checkpoint file grid stats through yt.print_stats() method.

flashy.plot.oneDim.locateShock(ray, vvv=True)[source]¶

returns index within ray of detected shock.

flashy.plot.oneDim.percentDiff(ax, file1, file2, diffkey, xkey='Radius', label='', **kw)[source]¶

plots the percentage difference for diffkey for two filenames.

flashy.plot.oneDim.plotter(ax, filename, key, xkey='Radius', label='', log=1, **kwargs)[source]¶

plots ‘key’ values from a data dictionary

flashy.plot.oneDim.roughCJ(ray, point)[source]¶
flashy.plot.oneDim.shock1D(rad, soundspeeds, inward=True)[source]¶

finds a shock in an array by detecting the last large variation within it that is larger than the mean of deltas.

flashy.plot.oneDim.writeProf(filename, profD)[source]¶

writes a 1D profile dict to a file.

flashy.plot.twoDim module¶

flashy.plot.twoDim.bifold(fname, mhead=True, topfield='density', tlims=[0.1, 40000000.0], width=1100000000.0, botfield='temperature', blims=[30000000.0, 2000000000.0], lintop=False, show=False, linbot=False, name='')[source]¶

Plots 2 properties as a joined sphere.

flashy.plot.twoDim.customFormatter(factor, prec=1, width=2)[source]¶

specialized format for plotting labels: width(prec) x 10^factor.

flashy.plot.twoDim.fileProfile(fname, species=['he4 ', 'c12 ', 'o16 ', 'ne20', 'mg24', 'si28', 's32 ', 'ar36', 'ca40', 'ti44', 'cr48', 'fe52', 'ni56'], thresh=1e-06, mrange=[0.0, 0.0], angle=45, radius=5000000000.0, show=False)[source]¶

plots a checkpoint file ray through the domain.

Parameters:
  • fname (str) – filename of checkpoint.
  • species (list of str) – list of species names to plot.
  • thresh (float) – ymin for species fraction plot.
  • mrange (list of float) – if set, change the mass range of the abundance plot.
  • angle (float) – angle of ray in degrees (measured from +y towards +x).
  • radius (float) – reach of ray.
  • show (bool) – return figure instead of saving it to file.
flashy.plot.twoDim.getDset(filename)[source]¶

Returns the yt dataset (not compatible with batch/parallel scripts)

flashy.plot.twoDim.getExtrema(filename, flist=['density', 'temperature', 'pressure'])[source]¶

returns a list of tuples with extrema for given fields(flist).

flashy.plot.twoDim.getRay(fname, direction=[0.0, 1.0, 0.0], radius=5000000000.0)[source]¶

returns a ray trace through the domain.

flashy.plot.twoDim.gridInfo(filename, silent=True)[source]¶

prints checkpoint file grid stats through yt.print_stats() method.

flashy.plot.twoDim.locateShock(ray, vvv=True)[source]¶

returns index within ray of detected shock.

flashy.plot.twoDim.mainProps(fname, mhead=True, grids=False, show=False, fields=['density', 'pressure', 'temperature'], linear=False, mins=[0.1, 1e+16, 30000000.0], maxs=[40000000.0, 6e+24, 2000000000.0])[source]¶

Plots the list of fields specified in yt.

Parameters:
  • fname (str) – filename to plot.
  • mhead (bool) – mark the position of the matchhead.
  • grids (bool) – overplot the grid structure.
  • show (bool) – return figure (true) or save to file (false)
  • fields (list of str) – list of named fields to plot.
  • linear (bool) – set linear or log scale(false).
  • mins (list of float) – minima of scale for each field.
  • maxs (list of float) – maxima of scale for each field.
flashy.plot.twoDim.planeSlice(fname, field, lims, zcut=0.0, linear=False, show=False, width=1100000000.0)[source]¶

Makes a slice at zcut

flashy.plot.twoDim.plotFRB(gridAx, cbgAx, imArr, lims, top=True, linear=False)[source]¶
flashy.plot.twoDim.roughCJ(ray, point)[source]¶
flashy.plot.twoDim.shock1D(rad, soundspeeds, inward=True)[source]¶

finds a shock in an array by detecting the last large variation within it that is larger than the mean of deltas.
